Question
========

In a study, it is investigated whether brain activity can predict what 
the participant has seen. Brain activity is measured using functional 
magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) and provides data in the interval 
\[-30, 30\], and the participant sees houses or faces. Now it is stated 
that (i) brain activity is a discrete variable and (ii) what the 
participants see (houses or faces) is a categorical variable.

Answerlist
----------

* (i) is correct and (ii) is incorrect.
* (i) is incorrect and (ii) is correct.
* (i) and (ii) are both incorrect.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* (i) is correct and (ii) is incorrect.: Incorrect
* (i) is incorrect and (ii) is correct.: Correct
* (i) and (ii) are both incorrect.: Incorrect
